Define Documentation

#define NUM_ARGS   6

The number of arguments that this program will take from the expression stack.

Function Documentation

float riemann_sum ( ESI  expression,
ESI  var,
float  lower_bounds,
float  upper_bounds,
unsigned int  numsteps,
float  offset 
)

Returns the rieman sum, for expression from lower_bounds to upper_bounds, with numsteps number of steps, using var as the variable of integration. Assuming lram is the default operation, offset * dx (with var as x), would be added to the x coordinate of every sample point.

float trap_rule ( ESI  expression,
ESI  var,
float  lower_bounds,
float  upper_bounds,
unsigned int  numsteps 
)

This function is very similar to rram, except that it computes the trapezoid rule instead, and has no argument offset, because there are no variations on the trapeziod rule.

float value_at_point ( ESI  expression,
ESI  var,
float  x 
)

Returns the float value of expression, when var is set to the value x.
